definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Inter-Rail passes are available for one month's unlimited travel within Europe.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲無限制旅行一個月的列車通票有售。

sentences.english: Passes are available for one month's unlimited travel within Europe.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲無限制旅行一個月的通票有售。

sentences.english: You'd better book through to your destination so as to save money and time.
sentences.chinese: 你最好買到達目的地的通票，這樣省錢又省時。

sentences.english: The Louvre is also covered by the Paris Museum Pass .
sentences.chinese: 購買巴黎博物館通票也可以進盧浮宮。

sentences.english: Do you know how much the fare is for a through ticket to yantai?
sentences.chinese: 請問買一張去煙臺的通票票價是多少？

definition: not to be charged for admission/(to be admitted) for free/free pass
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
